Spatial Sweeps¶

The angular flux calculations for different geometries.

One Dimensional Slab¶

Neutron Transport Equation

(1)¶\[\begin{equation} \frac{\mu}{\Delta x} \left( \Psi_{i + 1/2} - \Psi_{i - 1/2} \right) + \sigma_{t, i} \Psi_{i} = q_{i} \end{equation}\]

For the diamond difference method, using (1) with

(2)¶\[\begin{equation} \Psi_{i} = \frac{1}{2} \left( \Psi_{i + 1/2} + \Psi_{i - 1/2} \right), \end{equation}\]

the angular flux calculation at the cell center is

(3)¶\[\begin{equation} \Psi_{i} = \frac{q_{i} + \frac{2 \mu}{\Delta x} \Psi_{i - 1/2}}{\sigma_{t,i} + \frac{2 \mu}{\Delta x}} \end{equation}\]

The step method uses

(4)¶\[\begin{split}\begin{equation} \Psi_{i} = \begin{cases} \Psi_{i + 1/2} & \mu > 0 \\ \Psi_{i - 1/2} & \mu < 0 \end{cases} \end{equation}\end{split}\]

so the angular flux at the cell center is

(5)¶\[\begin{equation} \Psi_{i} = \frac{q_{i} + \frac{\mu}{\Delta x} \Psi_{i - 1/2}}{\sigma_{t,i} + \frac{\mu}{\Delta x}}. \end{equation}\]

These are for the steady state one dimensional spatial sweep. To change these calculations for time-dependent use, (1) incorporates the time dependent term. For the Backward Euler case,

(6)¶\[\begin{equation} \frac{1}{v} \frac{\partial \Psi}{\partial t} = \frac{1}{v \Delta t}\left( \Psi_{i}^{n+1} - \Psi_{i}^{n} \right), \end{equation}\]

where (n + 1) is the current time step. Substituting into (1) results in

(7)¶\[\begin{equation} \frac{1}{v \Delta t}\left( \Psi_{i}^{n+1} - \Psi_{i}^{n} \right) + \frac{\mu}{\Delta x} \left( \Psi_{i + 1/2}^{n+1} - \Psi_{i - 1/2}^{n+1} \right) + \sigma_{t, i} \Psi_{i}^{n+1} = q_{i} \end{equation}\]
